doc:
Nellie Bellflower https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nellie_Bellflower 0 Nellie Bellflower (born May 1, 1946 in Phoenix, Arizona) is an American actress and voice artist who provided the voice of Princess Ariel in the Ruby-Spears animated television series Thundarr the Barbarian. She has also been in The Last Unicorn (voice), Rankin/Bass The Return of the King, Americathon, the miniseries East of Eden, and guest roles on various TV shows such as Barnaby Jones, Barney Miller, Starsky and Hutch, and Happy Days as Fonzie's ex-fiancée Maureen Johnson, a.k.a. "The Lone Stripper", in the Season 2 episode of the series titled "Fonzie's Getting Married" (episode #13). Nellie has been involved in movie production with three projects: The Girl in Melanie Klein (2008), Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day (2008) and Finding Neverland (2004), for which she was nominated for an Academy Award as Producer for Best Picture. She is married to Michael Mislove. Nellie_Bellflower ( born May_1_,_1946 in Phoenix , Arizona ) is an_American_actress_and_voice_artist who provided the_voice of Princess_Ariel in the_Ruby-Spears_animated_television_series_Thundarr the_Barbarian . She has_also_been in The_Last_Unicorn_(_voice_) , Rankin/Bass The_Return of the_King_,_Americathon , the_miniseries_East of Eden , and guest_roles on various_TV_shows such_as Barnaby_Jones , Barney_Miller , Starsky_and_Hutch , and Happy_Days as Fonzie 's_ex-fiancée_Maureen_Johnson , a.k.a. " The_Lone_Stripper_" , in the_Season_2_episode of the_series_titled " Fonzie 's_Getting_Married_"_( episode #_13_) . Nellie has_been_involved in movie_production with three_projects : The_Girl in Melanie_Klein_(_2008_) , Miss_Pettigrew_Lives for a_Day_(_2008_) and Finding_Neverland_(_2004_) , for which she was_nominated for an_Academy_Award as Producer for Best_Picture . She is_married to Michael_Mislove .
